5.0.commit_message:
Merge pull request #370 from eclipse-ee4j/issue-368-getRemoteAddr

Fixes #368 Updates javadoc for getRemoteAddr

Fixes #368 Updates javadoc for getRemoteAddr

Fixes #368 with javadoc updates for:
 + reference to RFC 7239  for obtaining local/remote IP and ports
 + removed historic references to CGI variables
 + relaxed the dependence on the host header, which may not be present in HTTP/2

6.0.0.commit_message: Prepare next development cycle for 6.0.1-SNAPSHOT
Prepare release jakarta.servlet:servlet-parent:6.0.0
Add missing entry to changelog
List issues in numerical order
Most recent Javadoc update was in 2022 so update copyright date
Update schemas to latest (hopefully final) Jakarta EE 10 versions
Fix copyright date

Update javadoc for isReady

Make clear the scheduling implications of a false return from isReady()

Align isReady in ServletOutputStream with ServletInputStream

The current wording is causing confusion:
https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=65780
Be consistent. Link to the issue rather than the PR.
Spec needs 2 digit version

Update spec language to align with RFC 6265 (cookies)

Also add a change log entry
Deprecate comment in SessionCookieConfig
Also deprecate comment as it too is an RFC 2109 defined attribute

Fix #37 - update Cookie class for RFC 6265

In summary:
- setVersion() is NO-OP, getVersion() is hard-coded to 0
- Restrictions on cookie name relaxed to 'must be non-null, non-empty
token'
Align Javadoc for isStarted() with specification document
Ensure all @since Javadoc tags include 'Servlet'
Add forRemoval and since information to deprecation annotations
Update copyright
Javadoc clean-up. Mainly missing @since tags
Replace references to RFC 2616 with 7230-7235 as appropriate
Add missing @since annotation
Ignore directory created by Eclipse IDE

Add a module-info.java (#442)

* Add a module-info.java

Signed-off-by: arjantijms <arjan.tijms@gmail.com>

* Processing feedback:

* Make CookieTest public, remove existing opens statements
* Add open statement for the resources package
* Add entry in spec changelog

Signed-off-by: arjantijms <arjan.tijms@gmail.com>
Add additional entries to changelog

Remove restriction on ServletContext getters (#441)

Remove the restriction on programatically added listeners calling getter
methods on the ServletContext.

Fixes #416

Signed-off-by: Stuart Douglas <sdouglas@redhat.com>

Update maven spec dependencies, specifically of asciidoc

Some required config changes due to breaking changes in v2.

See https://docs.asciidoctor.org/maven-tools/latest/plugin/v2-migration-guide/

Signed-off-by: arjantijms <arjan.tijms@gmail.com>
Fix non-ASCII character corruption in c04d563
Fix IDE warnings re missing serialVersionUID
Fix unused field warning
Remove unnecessary cast and silence an IDE warning

Fixes generation of javadoc using JDK 11 (#437)

* Fixes generation of javadoc using JDK 11
* Change javadoc source level to 11 

Signed-off-by: arjantijms <arjan.tijms@gmail.com>
Add/correct copyright for new files added in 2021
Update copyroght dates for files modified in 2021
Update copyright checks to include new files that are (c) contributors

Make pom better suitable for JDK11+ build
fixed bad chars in asciidoc (#429)

Make pom better suitable for JDK11+ build

* Update versions
* Prevent normal progress to be printed as warning in javadoc


Signed-off-by: arjantijms <arjan.tijms@gmail.com>

Update to jdk11
Update to jdk11

update CI to jdk11

Signed-off-by: Greg Wilkins <gregw@webtide.com>
Update to jdk11

Issue #18 URI path processing (#424)

Issue #18 URI path processing

Co-authored-by: Mark Thomas <markt@apache.org>
Fix #111 - clarify Javadoc

Add generic attribute support to SessionCookieConfig

Also adds an entry to the change log.
The schema also requires an update. A separate PR will be provided
shortly to the schema project for that change.

Fix #411 No Object Wrapper Identity requirement for dispatch (#413)

Fix #411 No Object Wrapper Identity requirement for dispatch

Issue 225 do head content length (#405)

Issue #225 doHead contentLength

 + converting the contentLength field to a long
 + checking against bufferSize before setting a content length to simulate a buffer overflow
 + support flush and close
 + pass through async IO listener

* Issue #225 doHead contentLength

 + check content-length against buffer size on every write

* Improved clarity of the writer flush mechanism

* Added unit test

* Alternate approach
 + fixed some definite bugs in Nobody response
 + made the use of Nobody response optional.

* + use SC init parameter to enable legacy doHead handling

* Deprecated legacy mode and added text in spec

* format

Signed-off-by: Greg Wilkins <gregw@webtide.com>

* format

Signed-off-by: Greg Wilkins <gregw@webtide.com>

* merged and updated for deprecated and new methods.

Clarifly the JSR-133 sematics of the init methods

Fixes #81

Signed-off-by: Stuart Douglas <sdouglas@redhat.com>

Add support for an additional property: getErrorOnELNotFound()

This is in support of:
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/jsp-api/issues/40
Fix invalid javadoc
Remove deprecated code (#419)

Fix #407 add identifiers for debug logging (#417)

* Fix #407 add identifiers for debug logging

* Implement review comments from gregw
Next version is now planned to be 6.0 rather than 5.1
Fix comment typo
Fix Javadoc warnings

Servlet api issue 175 add cookie set attribute v3 (#401)

* Add Cookie#setAttribute
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/servlet-api/issues/175
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/servlet-api/pull/271

* Skip null value from check for reserved token

* Alternative approach to cookie attribute handling
github.com/eclipse-ee4j/servlet-api/pull/399#discussion_r624276777

* Make sure path is referenced via constant

* In hindsight, token check doesn't need to be performed on value

* Match casing with spec; mapping is case insensitive anyway

* Optimized Cookie to lazily create attribute map

* Added junit test

* Updates from review

* Fixed quote

* surefire plugin

* Updates from review

* Updates from review

Co-authored-by: Bauke Scholtz <balusc@gmail.com>

Merge pull request #390 from markt-asf/fix-ci

Update maven-bundle-plugin to latest to fix CI failure with newer JREs

Update maven-bundle-plugin to latest to fix CI failure with newer JREs

The previous version of the plug-in triggers a
ConcurrentModificationException on newer JREs. The likely root cause is
https://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk/jdk/rev/65b345254ca3
The newer maven-bundle-plugin has been updated to avoid the issue.

Signed-off-by: Mark Thomas <markt@apache.org>

Fixes #368 Updates javadoc for getRemoteAddr

Fixes #368 with javadoc updates for:
 + reference to RFC 7239  for obtaining local/remote IP and ports
 + removed historic references to CGI variables
 + relaxed the dependence on the host header, which may not be present in HTTP/2

master.commit_message:
Fix #431 - getParameter() may throw runtime exception

Applies to all of the parameter methods
Containers may provide options for alternative error handling
Fix #536 - correct minimum Java and Maven versions
Update references to the Jakarta Platform specification
Remove reference to Managed Bean Specification
Update reserved attribute names
Fix Javadoc warnings
Fix IDE (Eclipse) warnings in tests
Ensure clean layout with one listener per line in the table
Consistent formatting
Correct typo - see #522
Minor improvements. Add @since. Improve wording.
Add support for headers that occur more than once

Fix #517 - Mention what are the expected values of the jakarta.servlet.*.mapping attributes at the text of session 9 (Dispatching Requests)

Signed-off-by: Flavia Rainone <frainone@redhat.com>
Fix #469 - Remove sensitive header on TRACE method
Add missing @since tags
Fix #74 - provide more control over redirects
Fix #460 - rephrase description of uncovered methods
Update copyright date after PATCH support changes (#507)

Follow-up to #507

Fix formatting for updated format plugin.
Add change log entry.

[Issue 133] Add HTTP PATCH

https://github.com/jakartaee/servlet/issues/113
Copyright updates for formatting changes

Update to formatter plugin resulted in changes

Mostly removal of trailing space characters.
A fix fixes to indentation in a couple of HTML filea.

Update the build

There is NO code or any other source change then
Maven POMs.

Changes:
* update plugins
* centralize plugin versions in parent (for spec)
* make build work with Maven 3.9.0

Fix asciidoctor build warnings

This are not intended to be hyperlinks
Fix Javadoc errors

Trivial change to fix copyright check error.

The copyright check looks at last authored date. The merge of #499
retained the original author date of 2020 for the change to this file.
The date of 2023 in the file is inconsistent with that so the copyright
check fails. The sole purpose of this commit is to changed the authored
date of the most recent change to a date in 2023.
Fix copyright year. Missed in #500.
Clarify expected behaviour for CONNECT

Merge pull request #500 from markt-asf/fix-issue-159

Fix #159 - Clarify behaviour of header methods with null or ""

Fix #336 - expand list of supported HTTP status codes

Adds 308, 421, 422, 426

Fix for #468 - update HTTP RFC references

No other changes required to the specification
Fix #159 - Clarify behaviour of header methods with null or ""

Make API build reproducible

Signed-off-by: Hervé Boutemy <hboutemy@apache.org>
Further clarifications
Fix #273 - clarify behaviour around non-blocking writes
Fix secondary issue in #300 - context root mapping with or without /

Fix primary issue in #300 context path is always the context path

The context path does not change to "" just because the current request
matches a context root mapping.

Fix #316 - clarify behaviour of getMatchValue()

Add more examples, remove unnecessary text and be explicit about removal
of leading '/'.
Fix #443 Remove references to the SecurityManager and associated APIs
Fix #415 - add overloaded setCharacterEncoding() supporting Charset
Remove legacy CVS placeholder
Correct version references
Update Servlet specification references to use the agreed style
Add canonicalization clarification to methods that accept paths
Replicate warning for all methods that require a path

Fix issue-484 Add read/write via ByteBuffer

Clarify the behaviour of isReady().
Clarify the behaviour of read/write methods.
Clarify the behaviour of close().
Fix #275 - containers can use relative URLS for redirects
Fix #95 - clarify the HTTPS support is required
Update change log
Update version to 6.1
Fix #59 - Add 'query_string' attribute to error dispatches

Merge pull request #480 from markt-asf/fix-issue-473

Fix Javadoc issue highlighted by #473

Fix Javadoc issue highlighted by #473

Align Javadoc with current behaviour.

The default current behaviour is consistent with an implementation that
does not implement trailer fields. isTrailerFieldsReady() returns true
and a subsequent call to getTrailerFields() returns an empty Map.

Merge pull request #477 from markt-asf/fix-issue-325

Fix issue #325 - Clarify get[Int|Date]Header() for multiple headers

Fix #325 - Clarify get[Int|Date]Header() behaviour for multiple headers

This explicitly aligns the behaviour of these headers with the behaviour
of getHeader().
Formatting
Keep change log in sync
Fix #164. Clarify method behaviour is a NO-OP if called after commit.
Fix typos
Clarify that sizes are all in bytes
Add missing entry to changelog
List issues in numerical order

Update schemas to latest (hopefully final) Jakarta EE 10 versions
Fix copyright date

Update javadoc for isReady

Make clear the scheduling implications of a false return from isReady()

Align isReady in ServletOutputStream with ServletInputStream

The current wording is causing confusion:
https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=65780
Be consistent. Link to the issue rather than the PR.
Spec needs 2 digit version

Update spec language to align with RFC 6265 (cookies)

Also add a change log entry
Deprecate comment in SessionCookieConfig
Also deprecate comment as it too is an RFC 2109 defined attribute

In summary:
- setVersion() is NO-OP, getVersion() is hard-coded to 0
- Restrictions on cookie name relaxed to 'must be non-null, non-empty
token'

Issue 225 do head content length (#405)

Issue #225 doHead contentLength

 + converting the contentLength field to a long
 + checking against bufferSize before setting a content length to simulate a buffer overflow
